title.narrative: WaSH Community of Practice – Learning and knowledge sharing for Oxfam Wash Staff

description.narrative: The project aims to increase capacity of country teams and partners to develop, implement and learn from regional WASH work that influence policies and leverage systemic changes and bring transformational changes in WASH sector benefitting men, women and children. In order to develop Oxfam's approach to WASH programming in the region; the project will build Oxfam's internal WASH capacity through: (i) direct advisory support on key regional capacity building initiatives; (ii) knowledge sharing and the development of MECIS WASH Community of Practice; (iii) flagships and WASH learning events; (iv) staff development through coaching, mentoring and secondments; (v) documenting Lessons Learned (LL) from WASH programmes and disseminating learning. What we plan to do: Strengthening programme quality in MECIS WASH programmes (humanitarian and development) through country support visits and in country training. (2 locations @ GBP 3,000 location). MECIS WASH Community of Practice (CoP) activities including: Knowledge Sharing Forums (GBP 2,500, event cost: 5 days x GBP500; GBP 4,000, travel: 6 people x GBP750; GBP 8,000, accommodation: 20 people x 5 days x GBP50). WASH learning visits to Tajikistan and other country programmes exchanges (Flagship reviews twice per year: 2 x 2 people @ GBP2,000 per person + 2 staff/consultants @ GBP4,000 for other WASH learning exchanges). Support to D level staff through contributions to regional WASH secondments (4 people: travel and subsistence @ GBP4,375 per person). Development of Lessons Learned publications, including: editing, publication and dissemination (2 x activities @ GBP6,000 per activity). Activities will commence in July 2016 and will be completed by 30th March 2017

mailing-address.narrative: Oxfam House, John Smith Drive, Oxford, OX4 2JY
